A4.text: Under the Constitution of France, French has been the official language of the Republic since 1992, although the Ordinance of Villers-CotterÃªts made it mandatory for legal documents in 1539.

A5.text: France mandates the use of French in official government publications, public education except in specific cases, and legal contracts; advertisements must bear a translation of foreign words.
